title: Product, Price & Sales Services Trainee
description:
Knowing the destination isn't enough: you need to know how to get there. Build up your own networks, exploit new ideas, consistently take the initiative. Inspire other people with your enthusiasm. That's the only way to give ideas the power that allows them to become true innovations. We want to keep driving towards the future, so our team is currently seeking you as:
Product Pricing & Sales Services Trainee.BMW Financial Services.
As a Product Pricing & Sales Services Trainee, you will be responsible for support to F&I network during quotation process and for prepare the benchmark analysis regards to brand, customer, dealer, pricing & product development, as well as propose and improve the dealer’s satisfaction perception of the network.
Responsibilities.Identify and support during projects that impact que quotation process.Operate users for origination systems for F&I’s and new dealers.Manage equipment stock for F&I’s.Create and prepare operation manuals for F&I’s,Prepare communication and support for employe’s program.Support during purchase processes.Follow up of payment process for incentives and commissions.Provide Product & Pricing training to dealers.Identify opportunities and implement innovative process improvements with retail partners through ongoing training.
Qualifications and experience.Bachelor's degree on Administration, Business, Finance, Engineering, or related field.1+ year of experience in banking or financial processes.Automotive industry (desirable).Customer service skills (active listening, problem solving and ethics).Microsoft Office skills (PowerPoint, Word, and Excel).Fluent in English language.

title: Volume & Planning Trainee
description:
Knowing the destination isn't enough: you need to know how to get there. Build up your own networks, exploit new ideas, consistently take the initiative. Inspire other people with your enthusiasm. That's the only way to give ideas the power that allows them to become true innovations. We want to keep driving towards the future, so our team is currently seeking you as:
Volume & Planning Trainee.
As a Volume & Planning Trainee, you will be responsible for the volume reporting and sales management as brand function for BMW & MINI, including follow up on target completion, as well as monthly dealer quota planning and volume steering across the region.
Responsibilities.Prepare and coordinate the annual volume program, budget, and monthly forecast if production, wholesale & retail sales program in coordination with relevant areas.Coordinate volume planning for the correct allocation of volume/mix for the region on an engine level.Achievement of sales volume, turnover, CoR and contribution margin targets through a proper product allocation (Volume & Mix) at each production cycle.Ensure positioning of brand within the premium segment through the achievement of the share targets.Ensure importer markets support to obtain production allocation and support order fulfillment by market & model.Coordinate the regional production, wholesale & retail sales plan for the company flagship products.
Qualifications and experience.Bachelor's degree on Business Administration, Finance, Marketing, Engineer, or related field.+1 year in Sales or Logistics (automotive industry).Customer service skills (active listening, problem solving and ethics).Microsoft Office skills (PowerPoint, Word, and Excel).Fluent in English language.

title: COMPLIANCE BUSINESS COORDINATOR
description:
Our customers continue to be moved by the dynamic driving experience every BMW delivers. And so do we. That’s because the qualities of drive and dynamism, with which our vehicles have become synonymous, are just as sought after on our production line. Thousands of parts, customer wishes, suppliers and processes require singular logistical talent: knowing exactly what, how, where, when and why something happens – often before it does.
 What awaits you?
As Compliance business coordinator, responsible you will be responsible of execution of approvals at internal platform for business activities related to compliance (exchanges with competitors, corporate hospitality, integrity checks of business partners), responsible for implementation of an effective local compliance management system in Plant San Luis Potosí and reporting obligation towards group compliance functions.Supports Management in implementing information protection, including prototype protection in the organizational unit, being the "single point of contact" for managers, information protection delegates (IPDs) and employees in the organizational unit, monitoring and reporting the compliance of the legal entity to the Data Privacy Protection responsible and compliance communication campaigns.
What should you bring?
Bachelor’s degree in Law or similar business related field.Master’s degree is an advantage.Advanced experience as compliance officer with Data Privacy and Information Protection advanced knowledge.Excellent communication skills.Excellent follow-up and follow-through skills.Ability to prioritize and multi-task, particularly when working under pressure and to tight deadlines.Good planning and organizational skills.Ability to handle confidential matters with discretion, integrity, and ethics.Good knowledge of MS Outlook and Office.Business-fluent in English.
Are you motivated and would you like to shape tomorrow's mobility with us? - Apply now!
At the BMW Group, we see diversity and inclusion in all its dimensions as a strength for our teams. Equal opportunities are a particular concern for us, and the equal treatment of applicants and employees is a fundamental principle of our corporate policy. That is why our recruiting decisions are also based on personality, experience and skills.Find out more about diversity at the BMW Group at: bmwgroup.jobs/diversity

title: Coord. Product & Price
description:
TODAY'S EXCELLENCE SETS TOMORROW'S STANDARDS.SHARE YOUR PASSION.
There’re many products on the market. So, what makes the difference? It’s the passion and dedication they’re created with. Our product managers set new standards connecting development and customer needs while enjoying significant freedom to take creative paths and come up with innovative solutions – from the idea to further development up to the product launch. The product becomes each product manager's own – and our customers not only feel this enthusiasm, they share it.
Coord. Product & Price.
As Product & Price Coordinator you'll be responsible of Product planning / launch management through definition of the market specific product strategy considering price, volume, and revenue forecast. As well as definition of a market adequate price positioning for the given product offer in coordination with headquarters.
Responsibilities.Adaption of centrally provided products for specific market product offer, e.g., adaption of performance according to the law (standard profiles, packages).Steering of concept development and time scheduling of product specific sales management measures for target achievement LCI measures.Launch preparation and market introduction as well as go-to-market measures for services.Concept development of short-term and product measures which flow back to headquarters as best practice in a long-mid-term planning.Execution of annual product and price measures.Reporting of volume and revenue related product &price requirements of markets to headquarters.Market specific preparation of product communication (e.g., sales literature and data systems); presentations and argumentations for dealer network.Support of sales training and events, CIC.Market-specific preparation of central communication measures for customers (e.g., translations, product data) input for communicative messages.Responsible of alignment of product and price data with local and central controlling and sales/ aftersales department.
Qualifications and experience.Bachelor degree in Engineering, Business or Management Studies.Preferred master’s degree.At least 8 years working experience in automotive industry or premium brand environment.Leadership experience.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Negotiation skills.Proficient in all MS Office products.Fluency in English.

title: TAX SENIOR SPECIALIST
description:
At the BMW Group, everything starts with passion. It turns a profession into a vocation. It drives us to keep reinventing mobility and bring innovative ideas onto the roads. Enthusiasm for joint projects turns a team into a strong unit where every opinion is valued. It is only when expertise, highly professional processes and enjoyment of work unite that we can shape the future together.

What awaits you?
• Proactively monitor changes in Mexican tax law and assess their impact on BMW Group operations.• Identify and ensure compliance with relevant municipal, state, and federal tax incentive programs.• Review direct and indirect tax returns, ensuring accurate tax classification of all sales and purchase transactions.• Implement and update procedural controls related to tax compliance, overseeing third-party providers.• Ensure timely and accurate provision of data for tax return preparation and submission.• Conduct in-house tax reviews and recommend corrective actions to improve processes and reduce tax risk.• Provide comprehensive support to the Tax Manager, contributing to the overall success of the tax department.
What you should bring along?
• Bachelor’s degree in accounting, Business Administration or related field.• 3+ years of working experience in tax control.• Strong understanding of Mexican tax laws and regulations.• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.• Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy.• Excellent communication and collaboration skills.• Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.• Fluent English Skills.
Are you motivated and would you like to shape tomorrow's mobility with us? - Apply now!

Equal opportunities are a particular concern for us, and the equal treatment of applicants and employees is a fundamental principle of our corporate policy. That is why our recruiting decisions are also based on personality, experience and skills.Find out more about diversity at the BMW Group at: bmwgroup.jobs/diversity

title: WAREHOUSE PLANNING COORDINATOR
description:
Our customers continue to be moved by the dynamic driving experience every BMW delivers. And so do we. That’s because the qualities of drive and dynamism, which our vehicles have become synonymous with, are just as coveted on our production line. Thousands of parts, customer wishes, suppliers and processes require a singular logistical talent: knowing exactly what, how, where, when and why something happens – often before it even happens. So if you’re a team player motivated by international development opportunities and non-stop ideas, we could be your next logistical career move.

What awaits you?
• Collaborate with planners to define and approve processes and equipment for structures and distribution points.• Secure head management approval for IT and purchasing decisions related to logistics infrastructure.• Ensure all logistics planning aligns with objectives from Structural Planning, including logistic structures, material flow, and vehicle project integration.• Develop comprehensive layouts for logistics buildings in vehicle projects.• Conduct warehouse and route availability analyses to optimize space utilization.• Perform scenario analyses for new projects, focusing on optimizing empty container routes.• Calculate container warehouse capacity and material train dolly requirements.• Analyze project throughput and space demands to determine optimal logistics infrastructure needs.• Plan and manage plant-internal traffic flows to ensure smooth material movement.• Identify and address plant/project-specific logistics requirements.• Collaborate with Industrial Engineers to evaluate and implement logistics solutions.*Supporting Spartanburg plant
What should you bring along?
• Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related business field.• 5+ years of experience in logistics or warehouse planning• Fluent English language skills.• Warehouse expertise.• Strong presentation and communication skills• 5+ years of experience in logistics or warehouse planning.• Fluent English language skills.• Warehouse expertise.• Excellent presentation and communication skills.
Are you motivated and would you like to shape tomorrow's mobility with us? - Apply now!

Equal opportunities are a particular concern for us, and the equal treatment of applicants and employees is a fundamental principle of our corporate policy. That is why our recruiting decisions are also based on personality, experience, and skills.Find out more about diversity at the BMW Group at: bmwgroup.jobs/diversity

title: QUALITY MANAGEMENT PARTS COORDINATOR / BATTERY MODULE
description:
Assuring the quality of our products always starts with a strong team, perfect concept development, right international sourcing strategy and strong teamwork together with our suppliers during the series development phase, series production and our aftermarket deliveries. People with highest sense of standards, exceptional mindset and real feeling of our products are crucial to secure the most suitable components for every of our vehicles. To pursue uncompromising quality, our teams are tasked to guarantee all these topics and even more.Today, we are seeking a driven Quality Management Parts Coordinator, who is ready to play a key role in the industrialization and successful launch of our e-mobility projects in Mexico. You will be responsible for an entire supplier’s lifecycle, from the evaluations of pre-selections until long-term quality management in our supply chain.

What awaits you?
• Ensure on-time industrialization of suppliers of the assigned components.• Guarantee launch team integration with the responsible QMT from the BMW plants regarding operational work, execution of pre-series, attainment DOC, assurance of ramp up curve, stabilization of quality levels of series products and integrating decisions, measures and agreements made with suppliers.• Define and agree reliability indicators as well as relevant critical characteristics to ensure quality standards.• Responsible of solving all problems related to the component’s manufacturing processes, as well as ensuring its quality and documenting all measures from the project launch until end of production (PQM, iPQ, etc.).• Ensure parts availability for all relevant build phases and events of BMW project launches. Successfully execute the process series before SOP with the suppliers.• Manage the part approval process and ISIR releases for the assigned supplier and parts.• Define the root cause and the sustainable solution to problems together with the supplier.• Control, manage and implement actions to achieve defined KPIs e.g., PPM / Tecsa targets / REQs.• Establish constant and pro-actively communication and feedback of the project, to process partners and management.• Constantly prepare status and strategical presentations of the projects assigned.
What should you bring along?
• Preferably B.S. Mechanical, Mechatronic, Electronic, Chemistry or Industrial Engineering.• 5+ years of professional experience in the relative production technology in an automotive manufacturing environment.• Excellent knowledge in Quality- and Project Management.• Know how in Industrializing Supplier’s Production.• High ability to handle high complex and high number of topics and issues.• Strong personality. Strong in negotiation and moderation internally as well as externally.• Fluent English, German is a plus.• Willing to travel on a regular base sometimes weekly (50%-75%).• Excellent team and communication skills in a multicultural environment.• Analytical and structural way of thinking.• Structural way of communicating and structured principle of operation and task administration.
If you you motivated and would you like to shape tomorrow's mobility with us – Please apply now!At the BMW Group, we see diversity and inclusion in all its dimensions as a strength for our teams. Equal opportunities are a particular concern for us, and the equal treatment of applicants and employees is a fundamental principle of our corporate policy. That is why our recruiting decisions are also based on personality, experience, and skills.Find out more about diversity at the BMW Group at: bmwgroup.jobs/diversity

title: SENIOR MATERIAL FLOW PLANNING
description:
Logistics concepts need to work, not only fascinate. Despite the myriad unforeseen circumstances that can impact at any given stage or time. That’s why they need to be brought to life on a daily basis by agile international teams – and people who know how to work together to find creative solutions to challenging problems, with an impeccable sense of timing.
What awaits you?
• Plan and document logistical supply processes, ensuring efficient material flow from warehouse to production lines and return of empty containers.• Collaborate with planners to define and approve optimal processes, equipment, structures, and distribution points for efficient material handling.• Leverage warehouse and route availability analyses to optimize space utilization and container routes.• Conduct scenario analyses for new projects, focusing on maximizing efficiency, especially for empty container movement.• Perform calculations to determine container warehouse capacity, material train dolly requirements, and overall logistics infrastructure needs based on project throughput and space demands.• Work with Industrial Engineers to evaluate and implement effective logistics solutions across the plant.• Plan and manage internal plant traffic flows to ensure smooth and efficient material movement.• Identify and address plant/project-specific logistics requirements, ensuring a seamless supply chain.• Partner with key stakeholders like IT and Purchasing to secure necessary resources for implementing approved logistics plans (requires head management approval).• Develop comprehensive logistics building layouts for vehicle projects, ensuring optimal space utilization and material flow.
What should you bring along?
• Bachelor's degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Industrial Engineering, or a related field with a focus on material flow and optimization.• 3+ years of experience in logistics planning, warehouse management, or a related field with a strong track record of improving material flow efficiency.• Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel a plus).• SAP Knowledge• Experience with logistics software (e.g., Warehouse Management Systems, Transportation Management Systems) a plus.• Certification in Production and Inventory Management (CPIM) a plus.• Fluency in English.
Are you motivated and would you like to shape tomorrow's mobility with us? - Apply now!

Equal opportunities are a particular concern for us, and the equal treatment of applicants and employees is a fundamental principle of our corporate policy. title: Sen. Spec. Accounting
description:
FUTURE IS THE BEST INVESTMENT PROJECT.
SHARE YOUR PASSION.
Always under control, always with passion: those who want to shape the future need to keep track especially when it comes to goal-oriented corporate management. Thanks to extensive training and qualified teams, our finance colleagues create decisive added value for the BMW Group anew every day because they know what really counts.
Sen. Spec. Accounting.
As a Senior Specialist Accounting, you will be responsible for overseeing general accounting operations by controlling and verifying BMW FS transactions and financial statements.
Responsibilities.Account for BMW Leasing credit losses and reconcile with the contract management system.Reconcile the accounting system with the Retail Finance contract management system.Reconcile the portfolio of the San Luis Potosi Plant.Prepare and execute the necessary adjusting entries to clear the reconciling items in the General Ledger, including sufficient supporting documentation.Manage the company's fixed assets and their monthly depreciation.Account for fixed assets for BMW Leasing, including security deposits.Post extensions, terminations, transfers to inventory, sales and subsequent invoice generation in the accounting system.Oversee and manage the validation of the net clearing process for leasing contracts.Be responsible for the various entries for Standard Leasing, write-offs and retail reserves.Lead and coordinate the thorough research and analysis of reconciling items to ensure proper resolution within established guidelines.Reconcile accruals including depreciation for both entities.Be responsible for insurance related postings, including overseeing the collection of insurance commissions.Manage assignments, coordinate and respond to internal and external audit queries and independently follow up on open issues.
 Qualifications and experience.Bachelor's degree on Accounting or related field.5+ years of experience in accounting.3+ years of experience in banking or financial services industry.Experience in automotive industry (desirable).Customer service skills (active listening, problem solving and ethics).Microsoft Office skills (PowerPoint, Word and Excel).Fluent in English language.

title: Motor Vehicle Technician Apprentice
description:
BMW Park Royal is looking for a Motor Vehicle Technician Apprentice.

Your role

You will be working in a busy BMW/MINI workshop environment, where you will be responsible for maintaining and repairing motor vehicles to the high standards of the BMW/MINI brand.

All BMW Motor Vehicle Technician Apprentices attend the BMW Group Academy UK in Berkshire for their off-the-job training. This ensures consistent training throughout the UK and allows our apprentices to train on up-to-the-minute products and technology. The training takes place over a 3-year period and takes the form of classroom and workshop sessions.

The Course Is Unique To BMW With a Special Emphasis On Electronics And Cutting-edge Technology; Your Training Will Include The Opportunity To Work On The Latest

CarsEngines and BMW diagnostic equipment

Ultimately Leading To The Ability To Undertake

MaintenanceServiceRepair activities on vehicles to the highest standards once fully qualified

During the time spent at your Retailer, a mentor will be allocated to oversee the work-based learning programme. A BMW representative will also visit on a 12-weekly basis to set performance targets and ensure any development needs are being met.

Working Hours

40 Hrs per week, Monday to Friday , 8.00am - 17.00pm.Saturday working ( as per rota).25 Days annual leave, plus bank holidays.

Your profile

Desired Skills

To have good manual dexterity.

Personal Qualities

A keen interest and enthusiasm for automotive vehicles and the industry as a wholeTo be honest and trustworthy with a willingness to learnA positive attitude and work ethic, with high level of professionalismTo be able to work effectively as part of a team in a busy workshop environment, as well as having the capability to follow instructions and work individually

Desired Qualifications

Applicants are required to have, or are predicted to obtain, GCSEs at grades A*-C/9-4 (or equivalent) in the following subjects:

EnglishMathsOne other subject

Future Prospects

On successful completion of the apprenticeship, you will continue your development on the BMW Technical Programme.

Things To Consider

Successful applicants must be prepared to travel to the BMW Group Academy in Berkshire to complete their apprenticeship training.

Training is completed in one-week blocks approximately once every two-three months.

All training costs are covered by the BMW Retailer (travel, accommodation and food).

About The Employer

All Motor Vehicle Technician, Aftersales Customer Service (Parts & Service) and Motorcycle Technician Apprentices will be employed at their local BMW Retailer, and will attend the BMW Group Academy for their training. The BMW Group Academy is based at Wokefield Park near Reading in Berkshire.

All Bodyshop Technician (Paint & Panel) Apprentices will be employed at their local BMW Retailer or Bodyshop, and will attend our body training facility for their training. The body training facility is located in Milton Keynes.

Employer

BMW Group Academy

Training Provider

IMI Level 3 Motor Vehicle Service and Maintenance TechnicianIMI Level 3 Award in Automotive Refrigeration HandlingIMI Level 2 Award in Electric / Hybrid VehicleIMI Accreditation Service Maintenance Technician

Apprenticeship Standard

Motor vehicle service and maintenance technician (light vehicle)

Applications for this apprenticeship are being processed by BMW Group Academy.

title: BMW Vehicle Technician NEW
description:
Park Lane Aftersales is looking for a Vehicle Technician.

Your role

Working on the electrical and mechanical systems for a range of BMW & MINI models, every day will be packed with variety. With our diagnostic technology at your fingertips, you’ll inspect components for wear and tear, carry out technical maintenance, repair or replace parts, as well as verifying vehicle functions and their subsystems.

Your profile

Your technical or vocational training in an automotive retailer or similar environment will be backed by experience working with prestige vehicles. A full driving licence is essential. We’ll also expect you to be a team player who’s continually focused on the needs of customers. Be a BMW Certified Technician.

Working Hours

40 Hrs per week, Monday to Friday , 8.00am - 17.00pm.Saturday working ( as per rota).25 Days annual leave, plus bank holidays.

Rewards

BMW Group Car & Bike Scheme.BMW Group Pension Employer Contribution from 8% - 16%.BMW Career Progression.

title: Parts Advisor Apprentice
description:
BMW Park Royal is looking for an Aftersales Parts Advisor Apprentice.

Your role

We are currently recruiting for an Aftersales Customer Service (Parts Advisor) Trainee. The successful applicant will have the opportunity to work with one of the world's most prestigious and technologically advanced car manufacturers.

You will be working in a busy BMW/MINI Parts Department. Parts Advisor specific duties include:

 Interaction with both Trade and Retail customers – you will be working with customers on a daily basis both over the phone and face-to-face, to provide them with information and to sell them parts and accessories. Stock – this includes stock control and checks, as well as being responsible for ordering parts stock to be delivered at required times. Computer Systems – you will work on specialised computer systems, including computerised stock management systems and parts identification programmes. Vehicle Service / Sales support – you will support other Departments within the BMW Retailer, including workshop staff, to ensure they function effectively.

All Aftersales Customer Service (Parts Advisor) Trainees attend the BMW Group Academy UK in Berkshire for their off-the-job training. The apprenticeship will have a strong focus on the retail environment and the high customer service expectations of BMW & MINI customers, as well as Service Advisor specific training. The training takes place over a 12 month period at the BMW Group Academy and has been designed to suit both Parts and Service Advisor roles.

During the time spent at your BMW Retailer, a mentor will be allocated to oversee the work-based learning programme. A BMW representative will also visit on a 12 weekly basis to set performance targets and ensure any development needs are being met.

Requirements and prospects

Personal qualities

Successful Applicants Must Demonstrate The Following

 An enthusiasm for excellent customer service. An interest in the automotive industry. To have good communication and organisational skills. To be honest and trustworthy with a willingness to learn. To have a positive attitude and work ethic, with high level of professionalism to represent the BMW/MINI brand. To be able to work effectively as part of a team in a busy parts department, as well as having the capability to follow instructions and work individually.

Desired Qualifications

Applicants are required to have, or predicted to obtain, GCSE Grade A*-C / 9 - 4 / or Functional Skills Level 2 (or equivalent) in the following subjects:

 English Maths One other subject

Future prospects

On successful completion of the apprenticeship, you will be a qualified Parts Advisor. You will also gain a Level 2 Customer Service Practitioner. Following this, there are various opportunities for progression within the Retailer.

Things to consider

Successful applicants must be prepared to travel to the BMW Group Academy in Berkshire to complete their apprenticeship training. Training is completed in one-week blocks approximately once every two months as well as virtual classroom training online.

All training costs are covered by the BMW Retailer (travel, accommodation and food).

About The Employer

All Light Vehicle Technician, Aftersales Customer Service (Parts & Service) and Motorcycle Technician Apprentices will be employed at their local BMW Retailer, and will attend the BMW Group Academy for their training. The BMW Group Academy is based at Wokefield Park near Reading in Berkshire. All Bodyshop Technician (Paint & Panel) Apprentices will be employed at their local BMW Retailer or Bodyshop, and will attend our body training facility for their training. The body training facility is located in Milton Keynes.

Training provider

While the programme will focus around customer service skills, also embedded within the seven weeks training will include the current certification training courses for the Parts Advisor role. Additional technical and product awareness training will also be included.

Qualifications To Be Achieved

 Level 2 Customer Service Practitioner Parts Advisor Certification ERR (Employee Rights & Responsibilities) Workbook

Training provider

INSPIRO LEARNING LIMITED

Applications for this apprenticeship are being processed by BMW Group Academy

title: Senior Vehicle Technician NEW
description:
Park Lane Aftersales is looking for a Senior Technician.

Your role

You’ll work on electrical, electronic, hydraulic, pneumatic, and mechanical systems for a range of BMW & MINI models. With our diagnostic technology at your fingertips, you’ll inspect components for wear and tear, carry out technical maintenance, repair or replace parts, as well as verifying vehicle functions and their subsystems and performing retrofitting work. We’ll also look to you to support and guide other technicians and apprentices.

Your profile

Your technical or vocational training in an automotive retailer or similar environment will be backed by extensive experience working with prestige vehicles. A full driving licence is essential. A genuine team player who loves to share your knowledge with others, you’re continually focused on the needs of customers.

Working Hours

40 Hrs per week, Monday to Friday , 8.00am - 17.00pm.Saturday working ( as per rota).25 Days annual leave, plus bank holidays.

Rewards

BMW Group Car & Bike Scheme.BMW Group Pension Employer Contribution from 8% - 16%.BMW Career Progression.

title: Programador de PLC/Robots certificados por BMW
description:
Importante empresa dedicada a soluciones de automatización, se encuentra en búsqueda de Programadores de robots certificados por BMW para un proyecto temporal en Charleston, Carolina del Sur, Estados Unidos. 

Los candidatos seleccionados serán responsables de la programación, configuración y puesta en marcha de sistemas de automatización industrial, garantizando el cumplimiento de los estándares de calidad y seguridad establecidos por BMW y nuestros proveedores de tecnología.

Responsabilidades y funciones principales:

Programar y configurar sistemas de PLC y robots de acuerdo con los estándares y especificaciones técnicas de BMW.Realizar pruebas y validaciones de sistemas, asegurando la funcionalidad y eficiencia de los mismos.Colaborar con equipos de ingeniería y proveedores para solucionar problemas técnicos y optimizar procesos.Documentar procedimientos y configuraciones, manteniendo registros precisos y actualizados.

Requisitos:

Visa TN vigente para trabajar en los Estados Unidos.Disponibilidad para trabajar por un proyecto de 1 mes en Charleston, Carolina del sur, Estados Unidos.Obligatorio poseer certificaciones de BMW en: SAS-Hardware/EPLAN.WTB SAS/ SOV Basic Controls.TKB Commissioning trainingCertificaciones: KUKA Prog.1KUKA Safe Operation training por KUKA

Experiencia: 

Conocimientos Técnicos:SAS E-plan y SAS export files: Dominio en el uso y manejo de archivos de exportación SAS (carpeta de commissioning) es esencial.Manejo de EPLAN: Competencia en el uso de software EPLAN para la planificación y documentación de proyectos eléctricos y de automatización.Experiencia en Robótica: Habilidad para trabajar con proveedores de robótica y manejar adecuadamente los archivos y configuraciones necesarias para la integración de sistemas.

Estudios:  Ingeniería en software, Ingeniería Electrónica Industrial y Automática o Técnico Superior en Automatización y Robótica Industrial.

Idiomas: Inglés Intermedio (habilidad para comunicarse de manera efectiva en inglés, tanto escrito como hablado).

Ofrecemos:

Sueldo base conforme a la experiencia demostrada. Oportunidad de trabajar en un entorno dinámico y especializado. Los programadores de robots recibirán capacitación A01 en la planta de BMW.

title: Programador de PLC o Robots certificados por BMW
description:
Posición: Programador de PLC/Robots certificados por BMW 
Referencia: ROBMW-RI-R0019-EUA
Lugar de trabajo: Charleston, Carolina del sur, Estados Unidos. 
Descripción: Importante empresa dedicada a soluciones de automatización, se encuentra en búsqueda de Programadores de robots certificados por BMW para un proyecto temporal en Charleston, Carolina del Sur, Estados Unidos. Los candidatos seleccionados serán responsables de la programación, configuración y puesta en marcha de sistemas de automatización industrial, garantizando el cumplimiento de los estándares de calidad y seguridad establecidos por BMW y nuestros proveedores de tecnología.
Responsabilidades y funciones principales:Programar y configurar sistemas de PLC y robots de acuerdo con los estándares y especificaciones técnicas de BMW.Realizar pruebas y validaciones de sistemas, asegurando la funcionalidad y eficiencia de los mismos.Colaborar con equipos de ingeniería y proveedores para solucionar problemas técnicos y optimizar procesos.Documentar procedimientos y configuraciones, manteniendo registros precisos y actualizados.
Requisitos:Visa TN vigente para trabajar en los Estados Unidos.Disponibilidad para trabajar por un proyecto de 1 mes en Charleston, Carolina del sur, Estados Unidos.Obligatorio poseer certificaciones de BMW en: SAS-Hardware/EPLAN.WTB SAS/ SOV Basic Controls.TKB Commissioning training
Certificaciones: KUKA Prog.1KUKA Safe Operation training por KUKAExperiencia: Conocimientos Técnicos:SAS E-plan y SAS export files: Dominio en el uso y manejo de archivos de exportación SAS (carpeta de commissioning) es esencial.Manejo de EPLAN: Competencia en el uso de software EPLAN para la planificación y documentación de proyectos eléctricos y de automatización.Experiencia en Robótica: Habilidad para trabajar con proveedores de robótica y manejar adecuadamente los archivos y configuraciones necesarias para la integración de sistemas.
Estudios: Ingeniería en software, Ingeniería Electrónica Industrial y Automática.
Idiomas: Inglés Intermedio (habilidad para comunicarse de manera efectiva en inglés, tanto escrito como hablado).
Ofrecemos: Sueldo base conforme a la experiencia demostrada. Oportunidad de trabajar en un entorno dinámico y especializado. Los programadores de robots recibirán capacitación A01 en la planta de BMW
